greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest Sierpinski number that is divisible by the n-th prime.
comment: For an odd prime p and odd k, if p divides k, then p does not divide k*2^n + 1 for any n.
link: Arkadiusz Wesolowski, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
Chris Caldwell, The Prime Glossary: Sierpinski number
example: 603713 is first Sierpinski number that is divisible by 11, the 5th prime - so a(5) = 603713.
results.author: _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Feb 24 2013
ext: Offset changed and initial term added by _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, May 11 2017
